TopicTitle: Count-down timer on the launch pad

Articles.Content:
Just a little bit of aesthetics I guess, but the last couple of releases seem to have been focusing on that kind of thing too

oh - and a countdown timer on the website before each new version might alleviate some of the "when is it coming!!???" traffic in the forum too - especially in the last few days/hours prior to the release.

Not a bad idea, I like it! I'm guessing you would set a time, and as long as your rocket was throttled up, at the end of the time it would automatically take off?

I think there is a issue with the second suggestion. If Squad are going to tell us a release date, they generally only tell us the day it will be coming out on, not the exact time. Although, maybe they could add the time a couple of hours before the release goes live.

Jacob

Oh, trust me, a countdown for a KSP release is a really bad idea. Even given a vague date, it is often a bad idea. Releases can be and often are postponed by a day or two due to bugfixing needing more time than initially expected.
Besides even if it did help to alleviate some of the threads about when it was coming, it certainly wouldn't help with the pressure on the store when people download.
